title: What are the rules for performing a purifying bath in astrology and traditional rituals?
first_phrase: In this text, the author delves into the delicate topic of body cleansing and purification through bath rituals. They prescribe specific guidelines for taking such baths and explain their astrological and alchemical significance. The author emphasizes the importance of using clean and purified water, both for drinking and bathing, and mentions the use of rough cloth for scraping off impurities from the skin. All of these guidelines were developed by ritualists who made a science out of the analogies between the movements and qualities of water and those of the human body. In the last 200 tokens of the text, the author explains further how to take a bath, including the use of a piece of Egyptian cloth worn around the forehead and the importance of using pure water exposed to moon-ray.
content: Nei siti e nei paesi molto caldi, il bagno tiepido si fa seguire da una frizione generale con tela ruvida, quasi a scrostare l'epidermide del suo stato di secrezione immonda specie se si e' adoperata la lana grezza o non sufficientemente purificata, prima della tessitura, nelle parti nude del corpo' umano. In questo delicato argomento del bagno, come necessita' di nettezza e di purificazione del corpo debba ricordare al novizio, che analogicamente al movimento dell'acqua, alla sua qualità' e proprietà' se essa non e' potabile o e' marina, molte osservazioni furono fatte dal ritualisti, che del bagno parziale o totale del corpo umano fecero una vera e profonda scienza di analogia. L'acqua che si adopera in bagni domestici, se potabile, deve essere, dicevano i nostri anziani, presa dalla fonte 24 ore innanzi ed esposta, prima del riscaldamento ai raggi lunari, o all'aria umida della notte, al sereno, onde se germi ed impurità' vive, o animali, vi esistono, questi a contatto dello stato pregnante dell'atmosfera lunare, possono mostrarsi e sparire.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the ritualists of ancient times made bathing a true and profound science of analogy. They emphasized the importance of cleanliness and purification of the body, and noted the quality and properties of water used for bathing. As a novice, it is important to remember that the water used in domestic baths must be potable and exposed to the moon's rays or humid night air to eliminate germs and impurities. Bathing in running water from springs and rivers is also recommended for its purity. Avoid stagnant water, as it is considered impure and potentially harmful. By following these simple guidelines, one can enjoy the benefits of a truly purifying bath.
